title: Angular momentum cons - clay collides with wheel

content.question: A piece of clay is moving horizontally toward a wheel that is initially at rest. The wheel can rotate freely with negligible friction about a central axle that is fixed in place. The clay collides with and sticks to the wheel. Consider the system consisting of the clay and the wheel, but not the fixed axle. Why is the angular momentum <math alttext="vector L sub system" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>L</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> of the system the same immediately before and after the collision, while the linear momentum <math alttext="vector p sub system" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>p</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> of the system is different immediately before and after the collision?

choices.label: <math alttext="vector L sub system" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>L</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> is the same because the clay and the wheel do not exert torques on each other. <math alttext="vector p sub system" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>p</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> is different because the axle exerts a net force on the system.

<math alttext="vector L sub system" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>L</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> is the same because the clay and the wheel do not exert torques on each other. <math alttext="vector p sub system" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>p</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> is different because the force exerted by the clay on the wheel is a net force on the system.
